titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding the deployment of United States Armed Forces to Bosnia.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on International Relations, and in addition to the Committee on National Security, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 304.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2770 with 1 hour of general debate. The resolution provides for 1 hour of general debate on the question of deploying troops to the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. After general debate, it shall be in order to consider in the House H.R. 2770, debatable for 1 hour. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bill without intervening motion, except one motion to recommit. After disposition of or postponement of further proceedings on H.R. 2770, it shall be in order to consider in the House H. Res. 302, relating to the deployment of troops in the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, debatable for 1 hour. The previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motion. After disposition or postponement of the resolution, it shall be in order to consider another resolution relating to Bosnia and Herzegovina.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 190 - 237, 1 Present (Roll no. 858).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/13/1995--Introduced. Supports the men and women of the U.S. armed forces who are carrying out their mission in support of peace in Bosnia and Herzegovina with professional excellence, dedicated patriotism, and exemplary bravery.
